title: Why are humans so good at tracking eye movement? - Quora

response.answer_text: humans as primates are basically social animals, within which, eye direction is a form of body language.. if you or a male baboon say, stares at another male baboon, then just staring, fixing the eyes on, is interpreted as a or the start of a challenge.. as a curious person, when a drinker long ago i would caste my eye around a room of people, in a general expression of curiosity,, but now and then some other bloke would challenge me, “what are you, lookin at” having mistaken my interest in some old carpentry method around a door frame, or whatever, for a challenge to him.. sometimes you would hear a girl to her friend “quick! hes looking over here!’ meaning some bloke the had interest in, had directed his gaze their way [so best sit up straight or smile or whatever girls do in such situations],, ie, effects of the gaze.. if a dominant male looks at a lower ranking male [baboon say] or perhaps one of his females,, they will quickly avert their gaze,, looking away at something else.. thus ongoing monitoring and establishment of order in that primates world.. imagine you were in some social circumstance, with eyes covered, how would that absence of eyes and vision influence what you thought about, felt etc about the attitudes of others, including about you.. thus human etc eye movements have evolved to judge whether a fruit is ripe by its colour, whether another monkey etc, has spotted it too, and what to do next etc,, similarly the example of eye body language..

response.answer_text: I wish this were true for everyone…there are so many that seem that they can't see past the end of their nose But when you are playing a video game you learn to watch for little details that will get your characters threw each level If you are hunting you learn to watch your target so that you can get a clean shot Sometimes when looking at someone face and you watch their eyes you can almost tell what they may be thinking or what they are about to do Eye tracking is a very good skill to learn and one that will go on for a life time
